instruction: How many credit hours are required to graduate with a Bachelor's of Computer Science degree?
response: To graduate with a Bachelor's of Computer Science degree from Missouri State University, you need to complete at least 120 credit hours.

instruction: What are the core Computer Science courses required for the BS degree?
response:
The core Computer Science courses required are:

• CSC 130 (3 hrs) - The World of Computer Science
• CSC 131 (4 hrs) - Computational Thinking
• CSC 232 (4 hrs) - Data Structures
• CSC 244 (3 hrs) - Computer Architecture
• CSC 325 (3 hrs) - Algorithms & Advanced Data Structures
• CSC 333 (2 hrs) - Language & Machines
• CSC 335 (3 hrs) - Database Systems Concepts
• CSC 360 (3 hrs) - Operating Systems
• CSC 365 (3 hrs) - Internet Programming
• CSC 388 (3 hrs) - Intro to Secure Computing
• CSC 450 (4 hrs) - Software Engineering
• CSC 482 (2 hrs) - Seminar in Computer Science
• CSC 565 (3 hrs) - Computer Networks

instruction: What Math courses are required for the Computer Science degree?
response:
The required Mathematics courses for the BS in Computer Science are:

• MTH 261 (5 hrs) - Calculus I
• MTH 280 (5 hrs) - Calculus II
• MTH 314 (3 hrs) - Discrete Mathematics OR MTH 315 (3 hrs) - Algebraic Structures
• MTH 345 (3 hrs) - Statistics OR MTH 540 (3 hrs) - Statistical Theory

instruction: What Science courses do I need for the Computer Science degree?
response:
The Science course requirements are:

• PHY 203 (5 hrs) - Foundation of Physics I OR PHY 123 (4 hrs) - Intro to Physics I
• BIO 121 (4 hrs) OR BMS 110 (3 hrs)

Note: These science courses may also count toward General Education Requirements.

instruction: Tell me about Computer Science electives for the BS degree.
response: Students must choose 9 credit hours from Computer Science electives. These are elective courses ranging from CSC 300 to CSC 596. The specific courses you choose can be tailored to your interests and career goals within computer science.

instruction: What courses should I take for the Computer Science degree at Missouri State?
response:
The BS in Computer Science at Missouri State University requires:

 Core CS Courses (41 hrs): CSC 130, 131, 232, 244, 325, 333, 335, 360, 365, 388, 450, 482, and 565

 Mathematics (16 hrs): Calculus I & II, Discrete Math or Algebraic Structures, and Statistics or Statistical Theory

 Science (8-9 hrs): Physics I and Biology or Biomedical Sciences

 CS Electives (9 hrs): Choose from CSC 300-596 level courses

 General Education & Other Requirements: To complete the 120 total credit hours needed for graduation

metadata.topic: BS Computer Science Complete Degree Plan

instruction: Is the Missouri State Computer Science degree ABET accredited?
response: Yes, the Bachelor of Science in Computer Science degree at Missouri State University is ABET accredited. ABET accreditation ensures the program meets quality standards in technical education.

instruction: What is the four-year degree plan for Computer Science?
response:
The four-year degree plan for the BS in Computer Science at Missouri State University is designed to help you complete your degree in four years. It includes:

• Year 1: Foundational courses including CSC 130, 131, and Math requirements
• Year 2: Core CS courses like Data Structures (CSC 232) and Computer Architecture (CSC 244)
• Year 3: Advanced topics including Algorithms, Database Systems, and Operating Systems
• Year 4: Software Engineering, Seminar, Computer Networks, and CS electives

The specific semester-by-semester schedule may vary, and you should meet with your advisor to create a personalized plan that fits your needs and course availability.

instruction: What are the course requirements for the 2025-2026 academic year Computer Science degree?
response:
For the 2025-2026 academic year, the BS in Computer Science requirements include:

 Computer Science Core (41 credit hours): 13 required CS courses covering fundamentals through advanced topics

 Mathematics (16 credit hours): Calculus sequence, discrete mathematics or algebraic structures, and statistics

 Science (8-9 credit hours): Physics and Biology/Biomedical Sciences

 CS Electives (9 credit hours): Upper-level CS courses of your choice

 Total: 120 credit hours including General Education requirements

This is an ABET-accredited program. Meet with your advisor to confirm the most current requirements and create your personalized four-year plan.
